text: <!channel>: we have our official adidas kickoff on Monday - can everyone take the time today to read through the documentation posted in basecamp and post questions to the trello boarD?
feel free to change up the trello board as well - might be good to have a column for different types of questions or sections in the app
Could you add me to that Trello board?
yes!
Thanks
<@U0261PCRQ|kat> has left the channel
just added you
Appreciate it!
who's got the Glass?
its out here
by walnut table
i think this is our faulty Uncorked Glass
not sure where the one Adidas gave us is
stephanie mentioned after it was dropped off it was floating around the office. wish i could help more than asking <#C0260V1C3> :confused:
<@U0260V1BX>: Ewald says it's in the middle drawer of his desk
got it, thanks!
awesome, np
<!channel>: also it's helpful to download the miCoach iOS app and go to their online dashboard as well
<http://micoach.adidas.com>

text: <!channel> is there a secret to charging the glass? i have it plugged into my laptop but it was giving me a low battery warning and now I think it powered down.
there shouldn't be. Its entirely possible that it prefers a wall charger
or rather, it looks like its sleeping
and i dont know how to wake it up
anyone have a wall charger?
just say "Ok Glass" and jump up and down and say "HEY EVERYONE LOOK AT ME IM WEARING A GOOGLE GLASS"
<@U0260V1BX>: i think there's an android wall charger plugged into the pwoer strip to the left of my desk if there isn't a closer one
got one, thanks abby
Marissa mentioned she has a Google Glass design guide at home that she'll bring in on Monday. Might end up being useful to us.
do we know if there are going to be new guidelines for the 2.0 version
Israel mentioned that there are all new build tools to develop on it, so that seems to follow
was just going to say something to that effect - adidas mentioned that there are new terms for the elements - like the timeline is no longer a thing
i think it will be useful to get up to speed on current design guidelines regardless
agree.
there is also a good overview online
Any references you all might have would be helpful to me. I'm more so hoping for info on unexpected design scenarios that are unique to the Glass.
Things I wouldn't know to account for.
<https://developers.google.com/glass/design/>
was just going to send those through as well, those are helpful reads
Cool. Thanks!
this site is super informative
np

I dont think the actual design guidelines/interaction models are changing, but the structure of the OS is, as Abby mentioned. No timeline, v2 will have something called "NowTown" which I believe is meant to fill the same role... I would be surprised if the interaction models changed...
^ agreed
based on their wires and what they've said i also think the interaction models are staying the some
same*
good question to put on trello tho! :simple_smile:
i dont even think its worth asking. they would have told us if it was changing. that's a huge thing.
yep good point
i'm also just interested in the differences between google glass 1 and 2 in justin
in general* - no idea why it replaced that with justin
haha
i have # problems
Its probably important to know what it is to other people too
not just justin
yeah i am excited to see what the new form factor looks like
ha
pssh
nothing against justin!
to be fair though, i do think justin is the most important.
Oh i dont disagree
well that was all luck
I'm just saying that there might be other people who use it besides justin
maaaaaybe
likely
ok ok ok
seems like an edge case tho
i'll go back into my dev cave while you guys do your thing
